meanings.definition: To move at a moderate and easy pace while riding a horse.
meanings.sent1: The horse was cantering gracefully around the field.
meanings.sent2: I enjoy cantering through the meadow on a sunny day.
meanings.sent3: The horse started cantering comically in circles, making everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts were cantering through her mind like a wild stallion.
meanings.sent5: The rhythmic sound of hooves cantering on the trail was soothing.

meanings.definition: The act of moving at a moderate and easy pace while riding a horse.
meanings.sent1: Watching the cantering of the horses at the ranch is a beautiful sight.
meanings.sent2: The cantering of the mare was smooth and effortless.
meanings.sent3: The cantering of the pony in the costume parade was adorable.
meanings.sent4: The cantering of the stallion symbolized freedom and strength.
meanings.sent5: The rhythmic cantering of the horses echoed through the valley.
